pros: Decent hours, great coworkers, great clients
cons: large set of staff to supervise, endless trainings

review_title: A decent stepping stone place to work
pros: HR communicates very well and will work with your parameters required to maintain employment.
cons: -Besides a few good people UPPER management is inept at finding solutions, inconsiderate and money driven. -There is not a good work life balance, you are expected to do your work over taking breaks. I did not eat until the end of the work day if I did not pack a lunch.

pros: Very intense mental health experience Supportive coworkers

pros: Good people, fulfilling work, important work
cons: Terrible pay, unrealistic expectations, hypocrisy in executive team, lack of resources to complete most tasks

review_title: Good learning and intrinsic reward weighed against extreme burnout
pros: There are good people that work there, and it does a lot of good by nature of the company.
cons: Non-profit ridiculous rules that impede your ability to really help people, and the pay is horrible so its severely understaffed.

review_title: High turn over for a reason

cons: Very disorganized, rules are contently changing with no notice. Underpaid for the thing you do and the things you have to endure.

review_title: Work here if you’re poor and need money.

pros: Will get hired really  quick due to them needed CM all the time. Home visits allow flexibility.
cons: Overworked, overwhelming, inconsistent, no support for case management, no room for advancement, incompetent supervisors, very poor pay, clients does not come first. The focus is always on getting your 6 hours a day in order for the company to bill Medicaid; they play this off meeting the needs of the client; however when the client really needs something the ARNP is unavailable & doesnt listen to the clientd as well as the clients are not respected. Huge case loads.

pros: The clients were wonderful, sweet, and eager to get better. If they were not getting better its because Apalachee did not provide them with the help required such as a therapist or counseling sessions and caring medical professionals.
cons: They don't pay you for over time. After you resign you find out that they don't pay you for used vacation time. Also, they deduct your contributions for the 403b plan but they don't send them to the pla. Administrator so you have to fight with them to get your money back.

review_title: I totally enjoyed working for Apalachee center
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Quincy, FL
pros: Working for that company gave me a sense of pride, helping people who has been lost in the system and whose family were not close by, the staff became almost like family.
cons: The program was very new and we had to iron out many mistakes as we went along.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Quincy, FL
pros: Good hours. Decent pay for those trying to ease back in the working field. You get a first hand look into reality.
cons: The supervisors don't communicate well. They don't take enough safety procautions for the staff meaning they dont care much about throwing you to the wolves.

job_title: Mental Health Assessors/Intake in Tallahassee, FL
pros: You can really learn from this environment if you are reaching towards your license.
cons: Most of the staff then was not so communiating towards one another, so I brought it to the attention of the supervisor, and made him aware of the situation to try and get them all evolved as a team.

pros: Absolutely amazing clients, some staff members were very helpful
cons: Agency disorganization, interoffice bickering, inappropriate behavior from supervisor (including blatant racism), unmanageable caseload (I had over 100 high-risk clients)

review_title: I enjoyed my time there even though the pay was low.  I also had an understanding supervisor.
pros: Good coworkers, benefits available, easy to get time off.  Good experience working with those experiencing mental illness.
cons: Low pay, focus on billable hours, disorganization at times, had to drive to surrounding counties, had to go into undesirable environments.

pros: Friendly Work Environment, Advancement Opportunities for the Right Individuals, Great Chief Executive Officer & Chief Operations Officer
cons: Female-Dominated Human Resources Department (Nothing Wrong with Females, Just Unlikely to for Males to Be Hired), Lack of Diversity in Administration, Limits on Opportunities for Advancement in Administration

pros: Never boring, great coworkers, amazing clients
cons: No support, overworked, underpaid, minimal respect given, social workers are expected to do EVERYTHING, physicians are unprofessional and unethical, clients are re-traumatized every day, clients are barely helped, pill mill

job_title: Representative Mental Health Assistant in Havana, FL
pros: My best memories there were seeing the patients come in unstable and leaving completely aware and stable and thanking the workers for their help
cons: The downsides were the job can be dangerous and you could be seriously injured by an unstable patient out of the blue at any time. There seemed to be a lot of drama with the staff and there is no room for advancement if you have no degree in the available position

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Tallahassee, FL
pros: Always plenty of work to do to keep one busy.   Overtime is offered when the need is there.   People are great to work for and fair when a problem arises.
cons: No raises are offered.
